title: THE WEST ZONE message board | SHOP NOW: DEALS on CLEMSON app
text:
THE WEST ZONE message board | SHOP NOW: DEALS on CLEMSON apparel
Reflecting on the unprecedented collection of talent Clemson attracted to its junior day, we are reminded of Dabo Swinney’s news conference on National Signing Day two years ago.
The Tigers had formally posted their highest-ranked class in the Rivals.com era – No. 4 overall, their first top-five finish.
“Whether (recruits) want to come here or not is one thing,” Swinney said. “But they want to come see it. They want to come see Clemson.
“And when we get people on this campus, we have a great shot because it's special. It just is.”
Stafford (Va.) four-star tackle Nana Asiedu was one of four nationally-regarded offensive linemen on Clemson's campus over the weekend. Rivals.com
